title: Will Liverpool break Manchester City's record Premier League winning streak of 18?
text:
It would be the ultimate insult.

If Jurgen Klopp's high-flying Liverpool win against down-on-their-luck rivals Manchester United, they will have equalled the Premier League record for victories.

After 17 triumphs on the trot, just glory at Old Trafford stands in the way of equalling Manchester City's total set in 2018/19.

Pour more misery on Ole Gunnar Solskajer and struggling Tottenham stand in the way of Sadio Mane, Mohamed Salah and Co etching themselves in the history books with 19 wins on the spin.

Sportsmail analyses whether the Reds can break the record and what new record number they could set.

There are two teams standing in Jurgen Klopp's way from rewriting the history books

Roberto Firmino celebrates scoring against Burnley which began Liveprool's winning run

James Milner celebrates with his team-mates after scoring at Craven Cottage last season

Salah prays on the pitch after scoring against Huddersfield Town at Anfield in April this year

SPURS' FAST START The holder of the longest winning streak to start a Premier League season is Tottenham with 11 wins in the 1960-61 season. Liverpool have won all of their first eight league matches so far.

Manchester United (A) - October 20

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side are a mess. Liverpool struggled in the big away games against the big six sides last season, but United are in such disarray that surely the Reds cannot drop any points here.

Klopp's side only won one away game against the big six last season - away at Tottenham, which incidentally was at Wembley so it wasn't even Spurs' home.

Liverpool selected a workmanlike midfield in top clashes, which opposition managers caught on to and opted to sit back with everyone behind the ball - knowing the Reds would struggle to break them down.

This was evident in the last meeting between these sides at Old Trafford which ended 0-0.

Mohamed Salah celebrates his side's second against Spurs which was an own goal

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will likely have everyone behind the ball against Liverpool at Old Trafford

United were flying at the time - they had won eight of their last nine league games during Solskjaer's honeymoon period.

It is a vastly different picture now. They sit 12th and the United manager is struggling to keep hold of his job.

It's still a difficult match to call. Solskjaer will likely have everyone behind the ball and will see if Liverpool can break them down and Klopp is unlikely to go with a creative midfield to counteract that.

Liverpool's main hope will be Mohamed Salah being fit. If he's not, Divock Origi will likely play on the wing. On his last start, the Reds struggled to break down Newcastle at home before Origi came off injured midway through the first half.

One key variable in this fixture will be whether Liverpool's talisman Mohamed Salah will be fit

Salah celebrates scoring a stunning breakaway goal against Southampton at St Mary's

Van Dijk jumps in the air after scoring against Newcastle at St James' Park last season

Joel Matip is expected to be fit in a huge boost for Klopp - replacement Dejan Lovren has a history of high-profile mistakes and nearly gave away a penalty just before half-time against Leicester before the international break.

Even so, United are struggling for goals, and Alisson is likely to be back for Liverpool after returning to full training this week.

Prediction: Manchester United 0-1 Liverpool

Tottenham (H) - October 27

This one should be easier for Liverpool and would mean they would break the record with 19 wins in a row.

Although Spurs have caused the Reds problems at Anfield in recent years, like United, they are in turmoil.

They shipped 10 goals in four days as they were thrashed by Bayern Munich at home and conceded three at Brighton.

Liverpool, by contrast, haven't lost at home for two-and-a-half years.

Spurs' away form against the 'big six' sides is dreadful and Mauricio Pochettino is struggling

Salah cups his ears to the fans after scoring a sensational long-range effort against Chelsea

Spurs' away form against the big six sides is also dreadful. They only beat Manchester United away from home last season against their fellow big six opponents.

They did draw at the Etihad this season, but they haven't won away in the league since beating relegated Fulham in January.

The Reds should coast this and break City's record.

Prediction: Liverpool 3-0 Tottenham

Aston Villa (A) - November 2

Although this might appear a straightforward fixture, with Villa languishing down in 15th position in the table, Klopp should be wary.

Dean Smith's side carry a goal threat - they have hit the back of the net 12 times in their last four games in all competitions, including five at Norwich last time out.

They also appear to be finding their fete in the top flight after a slightly shaky start. Tyrone Mings, a newly-minted England international, is a towering presence at the back.

That said, it's difficult to see an expansive Villa side keeping out Liverpool's dynamite front three, so we make that 20 wins in a row.

Prediction: Aston Villa 2-4 Liverpool

Dean Smith's side have struck the back of the net 12 times in their last four games

Milner and Henderson celebrate scoring Liverpool's second against Cardiff last campaign

Sadio Mane points to the sky after scoring against Wolves in the last league game of 2018-19

Manchester City (H) - November 10

The title decider in November? It could be if Liverpool extend their lead at the top to 11 points by winning this game.

If City had Aymeric Laporte they would likely be favourites to win this considering the two sides drew 0-0 at Anfield last season and City only failed to win because Riyad Mahrez ballooned a last-minute penalty over the bar.

Guardiola has to drop Nicolas Otamendi for John Stones if they are to get something from this game and he will probably will do so after the number of errors the Argentine has made.

The Reds would have to install some creativity into their midfield to win this and Klopp always plays Georginio Wijnaldum and Jordan Henderson in these games, so this is why City are likely to end Liverpool's winning run and be the first team to win at Anfield since April 2017.

Not only that, it would revive the title race.

Prediction: Liverpool 0-2 Manchester City

Pep Guardiola has to drop Nicolas Otamendi for John Stones if they are to get something

description: Liverpool have won 17 league matches in a row. The Premier League record of 18 is held by their title rivals Manchester City. There are two teams standing in Jurgen Klopp's way.
